newsitem.title: USA: Hicks, Muse, Tate and Furst names new president.
newsitem.headline: Hicks, Muse, Tate and Furst names new president.

text.p: Hicks, Muse, Tate & Furst Inc said on Thursday that Charles Tate had been appointed to the newly created position of president of the company.
In addition, the privately held investment firm said John Muse had been appointed to the new position of chief operating officer.
Thomas Hicks continues to serve as chairman and chief executive of Hicks Muse, the company said in a statement.

Citing an increase in the number of transactions explored by the company, Hicks said, "We have decided to estabilish an organizational framework commensurate with our current needs and our plans for futher growth."
Tate, 52, joined the company as a managing director and pricipal in 1991. Muse, 46, has been a managing director and principal of the company since he co-founded the firm with Hicks in 1989.
